cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with the index coding problem, which is a well-known problem in information theory (cs.IT). The approach taken in the paper is based on graph theory and algebraic methods, which are commonly used in network coding and communication networks (cs.NI). The paper also presents a linear coding program, which involves optimization and linear algebra techniques (cs.DS). The problem of groupcast index coding is specifically mentioned in the abstract, indicating that the paper may be relevant to topics related to multicast and group communication (cs.SI). Finally, the paper presents an optimal solution that can be easily utilized for any number of messages, which may be of interest to researchers working on optimization and machine learning (cs.LG).
